results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Russell Thacher, Walter Seltzer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fleischer, Russell Thacher, Walter Seltzer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: One, two, three
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Pyramid Films, United Artists Corporation and Mirsch
results.brief_description: James Cagney shines in a virtuoso, verbal machine-gun fire perfomance as an American executive trying to sell Coca Cola to the Russians while preventing his boss’s daughter from marrying an East-German communist. How the would-be groom is converted into a capitalist before her parents arrive is part of this first-class farce.

results.title: The Public enemy
results.creator_credit: William Wellman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Cagney plays Tom Powers, the son of a Chicago policeman, growing up in the city slums where, as a boy, he naturally turns to petty crime as a way of life. As an adult he becomes a successful big-time liquor racketeer. Tom Power has no socially redeemimg traits. He takes pleasure in even the most petty of physical insults, such as grinding half a grapefruit into the startled face of Mae Clark. Cagney’s raw ferocious portrayal of a vicious criminal is masterful and the film is a classic in its genre. Also stars Jean Harlow and Joan Blondell.

results.title: The Lost boys (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Harvey Bernhard and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This popular 1987 film presents an interesting mix of genres: the 1980s teen movie with vampires. Michael and Sam are two brothers who have moved with their mother to Santa Carla, “murder capitol of the world”, unaware of the vampires residing in this fictional Californian Coastal town (the film was shot in Santa Barbara, and includes spectacular footage of the Boardwalk and beach-side amusement park). Michael is charmed by a girl named Star, and immediately falls in with a tough young gang led by David. It’s peer pressure in the extreme as Michael is tricked into drinking blood. He is turned into an unwilling vampire, and Sam looks to a pair of comic book vendors who are well versed in the dealings with vampires, to help save Michael. The insecurities and frustrations of youth are amplified and satirised by this exciting and funny MTV-generation thriller. Cast includes: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Kiefer Sutherland and Corey Feldman.

results.title: Blade runner (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Michael Deeley, Bud Yorkin, Jerry Perenchio, Sir Run Run Shaw and Ladd Company
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Stars Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.

results.title: Thelma and Louise (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Mimi Polk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Fasten your seatbelts as two of Hollywood’s hottest women rev it up and take it on the road! When unhappy housewife Thelma (Geena Davis) and her wisecracking friend Louise (Susan Sarandon) decide to take a break from their lives, they embark on a trip that leads to a tragic incident at a roadside honky tonk. In an instant, their weekend “getaway” becomes just that as they flee across the American southwest with the police one step behind. A classic twist of the usual “buddy-outlaw” movie, where men are most often the unlikely heroes, this film has a charming, refreshing and triumphant outlook. Co-starring Harvey Keitel.

results.title: An Unmarried woman
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Tony Ray and Fox
results.brief_description: Jill Clayburgh and Alan Bates star in this excellent production depicting the reconstruction of a life, as Clayburgh struggles to find herself after her husband leaves her for another woman. Torn between conflicting forces, her lovers and her daughter, Clayburgh learns to take control of her life. This film became a beacon for the Women’s Movement in the 1970’s.

results.title: Charlotte's web (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Iwao Takamoto, Charles Nichols, William Hanna, Joseph Barbera, Sagittarius Productions and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Lovable farmyard characters from E. B. White’s novel cavort, sing and explore their world. Wilbur the pig is afraid he’ll end up on the dinner table, until he is befriended by Charlotte the spider and saved by her magic web. Voices include Debbie Reynolds, Henry Gibson and Agnes Moorehead.

results.title: Two thousand women
results.creator_credit: Frank Launder, Edward Black and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Phyllis Calvert, Patricia Roc and Flora Robson star in this vivid document of 1944: a time when women were finding a new independence, and women stars and audience were taken seriously by British cinema. This intense story of a prisoner of warcamp in occupied france, takes the classic formulas common to male prison camp drama and transforms them. The women stand up to the enemy, outwit their jailers, help inmates to escape without tears or hysteria. They are mutually supportive in the face of their privations and their story is told through a woman’s eyes rather than from the male perspective

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Satyajit Ray Production
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.
